Class ScrabbleGame

java.lang.Object
ScrabbleGame
public class ScrabbleGame extends Object
A class that models a game of Scrabble.

  • Constructor Details

    • ScrabbleGame

      public ScrabbleGame()

  • Method Details

    • play

      public void play()
      The main loop for the game. Exits when the game ends and the user does not wish to play again.

    • nextTurn

      public void nextTurn()
      Refills the current player's hand, if possible, then switches the active Player to the next Player. Prints the game's board.

    • displayBoard

      public void displayBoard()
      Print the current board state to the screen. x is right, and y is down. _ marks empty spaces.

    • end

      public void end()
      Ends the current game. Prints a message that the game has ended, the scores of each Player, the winner (or tie), and asks the user if they want to play again. If yes, start a new game.

    • displayScores

      public void displayScores()
      Display the name and score of every Player in the game. Prints the name of the Player who has the most points if there is no tie. If there is a tie, print that instead.

    • scoreCalculation

      public int scoreCalculation(int x, int y, int direction, String word, List<Tile> usedTiles)
      Calculate the value of the play and checks if it is valid. If it isn't, inform the user and return 0. If it is, return the score.
      Parameters:
      x - The starting x position of the play.
      y - The starting y position of the play.
      direction - The direction of the play (1 is right, 2 is down)
      word - The word played.
      usedTiles - The tiles used by the player as part of this play.
      Returns:
      The score of the play, or 0 if the play is invalid.

    • IsFirstPlay

      public boolean IsFirstPlay(int x, int y, int length, int direction)
      Return true if the play is the first play of the game, and touches the center tile. Return false otherwise.
      Parameters:
      x - The starting x position of the word
      y - The starting y position of the word
      length - The length of the word played
      direction - The direction of the play (1 is right, 2 is down)
      Returns:
      true if the play is the first play of the game, and touches the center tile, false otherwise.

    • columnToNumber

      private int columnToNumber(char column)
      Return the column label of a Scrabble game as its internal y index.
      Parameters:
      column - The column label
      Returns:
      A y value corresponding to the given label.
